result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin G Hutchins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Restitution to be held open. Pay ZCI fees out of bond money. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

**AMENDED 11-29-2016 Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation at the rate of $100 a month. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.**

Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim CBF (person, property, residence or family). No COntact with Pudgy's Bar.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Justin G Hutchins in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Justin G Hutchins in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
